intro: Chrysanthemum asiaticum, commonly known as the Asian chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which come in a wide range of colors including yellow, orange, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features finely divided, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Chrysanthemum asiaticum is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and is also used in traditional medicine.
